reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: X-Emergency WASH Response and Capacity Building for conflict affected communities in collective and temporary shelters, camps and host communities in Deir Ez Zor, Ar Raqqa and Al Hassakeh.

description.narrative:
International Medical Corps (IMC) proposes to continue its WASH intervention in North East Syria through building upon its current programming in providing emergency WASH assistance and capacity-building support to save lives and alleviate the suffering of the conflict-affected populations in North East Syria. The proposed program will target 105,500 beneficiaries (including 73,850 IDPs beneficiaries), whereby IMC will work closely with Syrian Arab Red Crescent (SARC) branches in Deir-Ez-Zor, Ar Raqqa and Al Hasakeh in delivering life-saving assistance to those most vulnerable segments of society, particularly in communities that have lived through years of hostilities and deprivation in addition to endured prolonged periods under ISIL control. The beneficiaries will represent newly displaced people, people exposed to high intensity of hostilities, people living in last resort camps/sites/collective centers, spontaneous returnees and over-burdened host communities.
In order to alleviate the suffering of the communities and support maintain a healthy and safe hygiene environment, the intervention will adopt a strategic response and resilience-oriented approach through training and capacity building directly engage target populations in efforts to promote best hygiene knowledge, attitudes and practices to bring the desired behavior change.
IMC project will clearly adopt accountability and coordination mechanisms towards affected populations, in particular, conflict-affected women, men and adolescents (boys and girls), as the project will be open to all population segments, ensuring their meaningful participation in the design, implementation and monitoring of the intervention. Moreover, IMC project will mainstream gender, age and protection into its proposed WASH activities. **** International Medical Corps (IMC US) is a US-registered independent affiliate organization of International Medical Corps UK (IMC UK), with which IMC UK shares the same name and charitable objectives and mission. IMC UK and IMC US work together to deliver assistance programs in an accountable and effective manner in pursuit of their commonly-held charitable objectives. IMC UK will engage IMC US to implement its programs in the field, with IMC UK oversight, according to the terms and conditions of any agreement that results from this proposal and the terms of the parties' administrative service agreement. IMC US maintains a branch office in Croatia, IMC Split that provides administrative and operational support to IMC UK and to the programs on the ground, including but not limited to financial management, procurement management/international procurements, and logistics.

receiver-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs
